00138 {
00139   // 
00140   // the STCK data.  For example, the following bit pattern:
00141   // 
00142   // t 000000000011100000000000000000000000000000000000 
00143   // t+1 000000000000110000000000000000000000000000000000

00047 {
00048   // 
00049   // Perform a variant of run-length encoding on the times in the STCK
00050   // data, which are the most significant 16 bits in every 64 bit word.
00051   // 
00052   // Times come in sequences of consecutive words, with sequences separated 
00053   // by a "-1" time; generally there are a whole lot of words, many of which 
00054   // are entirely zero padding.  We store the time  of the start of the block 
00055   // followed by the number of elements in the block.
00056   // 
00057 
00058   int run_length = 0;
00059   int prev_time = 0;
00060   unsigned short prev_run_time = 0;
00061 
00062   for (int i = 0; i < input_size; i++) {
00063     if (input[i].time != -1.0) {
00064       if(run_length == 0) {
00065         int this_time = (int) ((input[i].time+0.1)/200);
00066         int this_run_time_diff = this_time - prev_run_time;
00067         if (this_run_time_diff < 2048) {
00068           io_buffer_put(output, this_run_time_diff, 12);
00069         } else {
00070           io_buffer_put(output, (1 << 22) | this_run_time_diff, 23);
00071         }
00072         output->num_codes++;
00073 
00074         prev_run_time = this_time;
00075       }
00076       run_length++;
00077     } else {
00078       if (run_length != 0) {
00079         if(run_length < 256) {
00080           io_buffer_put(output, run_length, 9);
00081         } else {
00082           io_buffer_put(output, (1 << 19) | run_length, 20);
00083         }
00084         run_length = 0;
00085       }
00086     }
00087   }
00088 
00089   if (run_length != 0) {
00090     if(run_length < 256) {
00091       io_buffer_put(output, run_length, 9);
00092     } else {
00093       io_buffer_put(output, (1 << 19) | run_length, 20);
00094     }
00095     run_length = 0;
00096   }
00097 
00098   return flush_output_buffer(output);
00099 }
